place.name: BURROUGH GREEN
place.gazetteerText: BURROUGH-GREEN, a parish in Newmarket district, Cambridge; 2¾ miles ESE of Dullingham r. station, and 5½ S of Newmarket. It has a post office under Newmarket. Acres, 2,217. Real property, £3,461. Pop., 427. Houses, 93. The property is subdivided. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Ely. Value, £705.* Patron, Charles Porcher, Esq. The church is old but good, and has a tower and several ancient monuments. There is an endowed school with £30 a year. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
